      static java.awt.Dimension getScreenSize()
      get Screen size
      static boolean isBiggerThanScreen(java.awt.Dimension pageSize)
      test than pageSize is bigger than screen (computer monitor) or not
      static java.awt.Dimension maximum(java.awt.Dimension a, java.awt.Dimension b)
      return the minimum width and height in a and b
      example: a = (200, 400), b = (500, 100)
      the result will be (500, 200)
      static java.awt.Dimension operation(java.awt.Dimension a, DimensionUtilities.Operation op, java.awt.Dimension b)
      a [DimensionUtilities.Operation] b = return result.
      static java.awt.Dimension operation(java.awt.Dimension a, DimensionUtilities.Operation op, int b)
      operate a with integer b
      The method will change integer to to dimension with width and height is b and run method operation(Dimension, Operation, Dimension)

      • isBiggerThanScreen

        public static boolean isBiggerThanScreen(java.awt.Dimension pageSize)
        test than pageSize is bigger than screen (computer monitor) or not
        Parameters:
        pageSize - page size (if you fixed size)
        Returns:

      • maximum

        public static java.awt.Dimension maximum(java.awt.Dimension a,
                                         java.awt.Dimension b)
        return the minimum width and height in a and b
        example: a = (200, 400), b = (500, 100)
        the result will be (500, 200)
        Parameters:
        a - first size
        b - second size
        Returns:
        the minimum size

      • operation

        public static java.awt.Dimension operation(java.awt.Dimension a,
                                           DimensionUtilities.Operation op,
                                           java.awt.Dimension b)
        a [DimensionUtilities.Operation] b = return result.
        Parameters:
        a - is first dimension.
        b - is second dimension.
        op - is arithmetic Operation.
        Returns:
        result of 2 a and b do DimensionUtilities.Operation.

      • operation

        public static java.awt.Dimension operation(java.awt.Dimension a,
                                           DimensionUtilities.Operation op,
                                           int b)
        operate a with integer b
        The method will change integer to to dimension with width and height is b and run method operation(Dimension, Operation, Dimension)
        Parameters:
        a - dimension
        op - operation
        b - integer
        Returns:
        operation(Dimension, Operation, Dimension)
